creator: xenoterracide@gmail.com
text:
In my distributions apache 2.2 build the -M option when run from the command
line is output to stderr. Is this normal? as it makes it somewhat difficult to
work with? I filed a bug there, and was told it was an upstream issue, I've been
told from other sources that it outputs to stdout.. I'm trying to confirm
whether or not this is correct behavior, and if it is what the reasoning is.

creator: takashi.asfbugzilla@tks.st
text: *** Bug 44266 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: poirier@pobox.com
text:
Created attachment 22747
Patch to output -M and -S to stdout

Here's a patch to send -M and -S to stdout, it's just one line each.

I don't know if there was some reason for sending them to stderr in
the first place.

creator: rederpj@remulak.net
text:
Although these two have apparently been writing to stderr since the dawn of time (at least the dawn of svn history) there doesn't seem to be any good reason to keep these two cases oddly separate from the rest of the dumps (which all write to stdout).

Committed to trunk and submitted for backporting.
